ddf_utils.chef package¶

Submodules¶

ddf_utils.chef.config module¶

ddf_utils.chef.cook module¶

recipe cooking

ddf_utils.chef.cook.build_recipe(recipe_file, to_disk=False)¶

build a complete recipe file if there are includes in recipe file, if no includes found than return the file as is.

ddf_utils.chef.cook.check_dataset_availability(recipe)¶

check availability of all datasets required by the recipe.

raise error if some dataset not available. otherwise do nothing.

ddf_utils.chef.cook.dish_to_csv(dishes, outpath)¶
ddf_utils.chef.cook.run_recipe(recipe)¶

run the recipe.

returns a dictionary. keys are concepts, entities and datapoints, and values are ingredients return by the procedures

ddf_utils.chef.cook.update_recipe_last_update(recipe, outdir)¶

ddf_utils.chef.ingredient module¶

main ingredient class

class ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient(ingred_id, ddf_id, key, values, row_filter=None, data=None)¶

Bases: object

ingredient class: represents an ingredient object in recipe file. see the implement of from_dict() method for how the object is constructed.

copy_data()¶

this function makes copy of self.data.

ddf_path¶
dtype¶

returns the type of ddf data, i.e. concepts/entities/datapoints.

It will be inferred from the key property of ingredient. TODO: what if key == ‘*’? Is it possible?

filter_row(df)¶

return the rows selected by self.row_filter.

classmethod from_dict(data)¶
get_data(copy=False)¶
key_to_list()¶

helper function: make a list that contains primaryKey of this ingredient

reset_data()¶

ddf_utils.chef.procedure module¶

all procedures for recipes

ddf_utils.chef.procedure.accumulate(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

run accumulate function on ingredient data.

available options:
op: a dictionary of concept_name: function mapping
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.align(to_align: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, base: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

align 2 ingredient by a column.

This function is like an automatic version of translate_column. It firstly creating the mapping dictionary by searching in the base ingredient for data in to_align ingredient, and then translate according to the mapping file.

available options:
search_cols: a list of columns of base ingredient, to search for values to_find: the column of ingredient to_align. The function will search the data of this column in search_cols to_replace: the column of to_align ingredient to replace with new value. can be same as to_find or a new column drop_not_found: if we should drop those entities not found in the base
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.copy(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

make copy of ingredient data, with new names.

available options:
dictionary: a dictionary of oldname -> newname mappings
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.filter_item(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result: typing.Union[str, NoneType] = None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

filter item from the ingredient data dict.

available options:
items: a list of items to filter from base ingredient
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.filter_row(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

filter an ingredient based on a set of options and return the result as new ingredient.

Args:
ingredient: Ingredient object result: ingred_id of return ingredient options: dict of options
available options:
dictionary: test
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.groupby(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

group ingredient data by column(s) and run aggregate function

available options:
by: the column(s) to group, can be a list or a string aggregate: the function to aggregate. Default: sum
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.identity(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

return the ingredient as is.

available options:
copy: if copy is True, then treat all data as string. Default: False
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.merge(*ingredients: typing.List[ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient], *, result=None, **options)¶

the main merge function

avaliable options:
deep: if True, then do deep merging. Default is False
About deep merging:
deep merge is when we check every datapoint for existence if false, overwrite is on the file level. If key-value (e.g. geo,year-population_total) exists, whole file gets overwritten if true, overwrite is on the row level. If values (e.g. afr,2015-population_total) exists, it gets overwritten, if it doesn’t it stays
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.run_op(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

run math operation on each row of ingredient data.

available options:
op: a dictionary of concept_name: function mapping
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.translate_column(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

Translate column values.

available options are:
dictionary: a dictionary of oldname -> newname mappings column: the column to rename base: if base is provided, transform the columns base on information of base ingredient. So that oldname column will be change to values from newname column.
Note:
if base and column are provided at same time, it will raise an error.
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.translate_header(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.Ingredient¶

Translate column headers

available options are:
dictionary: a dictionary of oldname -> newname mappings
